intro: Acinodendron amoenum, commonly known as the white-flowered acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
